I take refuge in all TathÄgatas, the Worthy Ones, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.
I will now explain this mantra of the mind of all TathÄgatas.
If there are devas, humans, or á¹›á¹£is who uphold the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«,
they should take refuge and make offerings to all Buddhas.

If one recites the syllable oá¹ƒ, it means perfect completion.
If one recites the syllable nÄ, it means being free from fear.

If one recites the syllable sÄ, it means subduing enemies and obstacles.
If one recites the syllable ni, it means destroying enemies.
If one is afraid, by the power of the mantra, one will be free from fear.

ViÅ›eá¹£aá¹‡a Sarva
This is the secret mantra of the one hundred and eight names.
If one single-mindedly receives and upholds it, recites it,
if one writes it oneself or explains it to others,
it increases longevity, auspiciousness, beauty, and the marks of merit, and is loved and respected by the masses.
Far away from the realm of Mara, born in the difficulty of birth and death.
And those heavenly beings, asuras, and others respectfully make offerings.
And they obtain the celestial, dragon, yaksha, gandharva, asura, garuda, kinnara, and rakshasa,
The assembly of vidyadhara sages, who respect and praise them.
All shackles and bonds are naturally released.
Lions, tigers, wolves, and evil hungry ghosts,
Enemies and thieves cannot harm them.
Violent winds, fierce fires, clouds, thunder, hail,
Rivers, seas, and heavy poisons cannot invade and harm them.
If there are those who remember the name of this Vighna,
The Bodhisattva always saves and protects them.
All the evil Mara enemies that come to oppress them,
At that time, the Bodhisattva secretly emits the light of his body.
It illuminates the sky like a hundred thousand suns.
That light is blazing, destroying the Mara enemies,
And even the earth and sky are all purified.
It also causes that person's wisdom to increase.
In seven lifetimes, one will attain the supernormal knowledge of past lives.
One will be born into a ká¹£atriya family and receive the body of a king.
After this life ends, one will be reborn in the Western Land of Ultimate Bliss.
The SÅ«tra of the One Hundred and Eight Names of Bodhisattva MahÄsthÄmaprÄpta
